item.title: Pixel Art Tutorials - Saint11
item.description: This is my series of tutorials that I made with the help of my Patrons, they are all 512x512 pixels and were primarily focussed on twitter but eventually became it‚Äôs own thing. All these tutorials are free, but if you want to support me, you can do it on Patreon or you can buy them in a nice .zip file on Itch.io. If you want to Ctrl+F (Cmd+F in mac) to find something, I added some tags to the titles to help with that, I also added a ‚Äò#‚Äô symbol before each tag.

item.title: How to Transform Your Board Meeting with Written Narratives by @ttunguz
item.description: Written materials transform board meetings. With most of us working remotely, many startups have thrown out Google slides and replaced them with Google docs. It‚Äôs a fundamental change, and one I hope persists after work returns to the new normal. Amazon is famous for its narrative process and contempt of slides. The email in which Bezos banishes decks reads: ‚ÄúThe reason writing a good 4 page memo is harder than ‚Äòwriting‚Äô a 20 page PowerPoint is because the narrative structure of good memo forces better thought and better understanding of what‚Äôs more important than what how things are related.

item.title: The Power of Defaults
item.description: I use every ounce of willpower to keep still. One wrong move might wreak havoc. After carefully assessing the situation, I move my mouse over the right option, select it, and press ‚ÄòNext‚Äô. Crisis narrowly averted, I am now confronting the next set of inane settings‚Äîuntil finally, this installation of Windows¬†10 is finished. Midway along the process, I ask myself whether the designers of the setup process are aware that the majority of users will probably select the defaults, thus making it easy for Microsoft to use extra diagnostic data, install additional software, and decrease the user‚Äôs privacy even further. Welcome to 2020!

item.title: Save the world with a personal carbon tax
item.description: This half, some of my goals are to raise money and awareness for climate change and to reduce my carbon footprint by 10%. In the past I‚Äôve done this by changing my diet and paying a carbon tax. Recently I‚Äôve been intrigued by the power of economic motivators as an agent of behavior change and particularly how I could utilize those motivators myself. One thing I‚Äôve been thinking about recently is to expand my personal carbon tax to help encourage myself to make better decisions and to make up for those decisions when I make a poor choice.

item.title: Etcd, or, why modern software makes me sad
item.description: Once upon a time in 2013, there was a tool called etcd which was a really lightweight database written around the Raft consensus algorithm. This tool was originally written in 2013 for a bullshit unsuccessful project called CoreOS Container Linux that was EOL'd several years ago, but that doesn't really matter ‚Äî etcd was greater than its original use-case. Etcd provided a convenient and simple set of primitives (set a key, get a key, set-only-if-unchanged, watch-for-changes) with a drop-dead simple HTTP API on top of them. I have built a number of tools using etcd as a lightweight consensus store behind ‚Ä¶
item.author: (James Brown)

item.title: Coding Adventure: Procedural Moons and Planets
item.description:
Trying to generate some simple little moons and planets to fly about and explore. Inspired by the (incredible!) game Outer Wilds.
Project Files: The files are currently available in early access to patrons of the channel (but will be made public end of July). If you'd like to get access now (and support the channel!) you can do so here: https://www.patreon.com/SebastianLague
Resources: https://www.redblobgames.com/x/1842-delaunay-voronoi-sphere/ https://www.iquilezles.org/www/articles/smin/smin.htm https://www.medium.com/@bgolus/normal-mapping-for-a-triplanar-shader-10bf39dca05a https://www.medium.com/game-dev-daily/four-ways-to-create-a-mesh-for-a-sphere-d7956b825db4 https://www.github.com/keijiro/KinoBloom https://www.textures.com
Music: "Brief Respite" by Antti Luode "In the Clouds" by Falls "When Rain Comes" by Tide Electric "Reflections of Space and Time" by AEROPLANES "Liminal" by Chelsea McGough "Frontier" by Shimmer "Sun and the Moon" by Moments
Sections: 0:00 Intro 0:25 Spheres 3:09 Craters 8:10 Noise 10:40 Triplanar Mapping 14:21 Planet Shape 15:28 Ocean 17:30 Planet Shading 20:06 Solar System
item.author: (Sebastian Lague)

I mean, it‚Äôs been a decade already, but still‚Äîrobots are hard, and giving a bunch of smart people access to a capable platform where they didn‚Äôt have to worry about hardware and could instead focus on doing interesting and useful things helped to establish a precedent for robotics research going forward.

The low barrier to entry, ease of use, rapid development process, and [‚Ä¶]

item.title: Handling SPA Fallback Paths in a Generic ASP.NET Core Server
item.description: When building ASP.NET Core backends for SPA applications one thing that you have to worry about is how to handle client side routes that end up being fired against the server through external or reloaded links.
